remarks: The supremum function distributes over multiplication, in the sense that ` ( sup A ) x. ( sup B ) = sup ( A x. B ) ` , where ` A x. B ` is shorthand for ` { a x. b | a e. A , b e. B } ` and is defined as ` C ` below.  We made use of this in our definition of multiplication in the Dedekind cut construction of the reals (see ~ df-mp ).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jul-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Sep-2014.)
statement:
supmul.1 $e |- C = { z | E. v e. A E. b e. B z = ( v x. b ) } $.
supmul.2 $e |- ( ph <-> ( ( A. x e. A 0 <_ x /\ A. x e. B 0 <_ x ) /\ ( A C_ RR /\ A =/= (/) /\ E. x e. RR A. y e. A y <_ x ) /\ ( B C_ RR /\ B =/= (/) /\ E. x e. RR A. y e. B y <_ x ) ) ) $.
supmul $p |- ( ph -> ( sup ( A , RR , < ) x. sup ( B , RR , < ) ) = sup ( C , RR , < ) ) $.
$d A b v x y z $.
$d B b v x y z $.
$d C x $.
$d b ph z $.
